page.title: 03LOCAL PEOPLE IN THE NEWS !
page.content: The new Carnival Queen of the Wecock Annual Carnival was Dawn Rowe. She was chosen on July 20th at Wecock Village Centre. She won Â£30, a dress voucher, a hair styling and a bouquet. A six year old pony was brought into Meadowlands School for the morning assembly by Kerry-Anne Stone aged 8. Helped by her father, she answered the questions from 300 pupils. Animals have been brought to school to encourage children's interests in different areas of school work. The police turned a resident of Cowplain away from Stonehenge. He has gone to celebrate the summer solstice every year since he was 16. The Brewmaster pub, for the fourth year running, has had the most intelligent drinkers. This year's team won the Whitbread regional competition.
